response_parsed.title: Observing Microservices with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to use FastAPI to monitor and observe microservices in a Python 3.12+ environment.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern, high-performance web framework for building APIs in Python.
In this example, we'll use FastAPI to monitor microservices within a 3.12+ context.
The code will demonstrate setting up routes, handling requests, and using various middleware for observation purposes.
By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of observing microservices with FastAPI in Python 3.12+

code_examples.code:
```
# Import required libraries
nse = prometheus_client.start_http_server(8001)
metrics = prometheus_client.CoreMetrics()
app = FastAPI()
@app.get('/metrics')
def metrics():
    return metrics.collect()nn``

caveats: Ensure you have FastAPI and Prometheus client installed in your Python environment.
This example uses Prometheus for monitoring, which is an optional choice; other observability libraries can be used as well.
